title: Can send but can’t receive emails with Thunderbird
content: I have an Optus email and use Thunderbird, for a week now I can only send but not receive emails with my Optus net email in Thunderbird, phoned Optus up say the problem is not theirs,got an it expert in spent 2hours on it at a cost of @$250 said to me ,everything is fine it seems Optus is blocking the Optus email from coming in,note I can send and receive emails with my iPhone with Optus email but not in Thunderbird. I am pulling my hair out is there a solution to this? Spent 20 hours plus trying to solve it ket alone paying an it technician plus on the phone to Optus and NO SOLUTION!!
creator: crownoptics

title: How DID I import a single (also need multiple) .EML file into TB 115.10 -- and now can't duplicate (no extension needed)?
content:
After wasting hours trying “this and that” – I did successfully "import" (not in the “import” menu) a single .EML (text) email file into my TB 115.10 e-client? I can’t remember how – and can’t duplicate it.

Yes, I know there’s an “extension” to do this, but if I did it only with TB 115.10 – why deal with the paranoia of permissions (must have access to everything)?

I need to “move” about 4000 emails from an ancient ISP (still used, too) into my TB 115.10 e-client – to then move to ”Folders” and then archive off-line. I can download emails (to my folder) from the ISP only individually as .EML files – and did get one successfully into TB (it reads [looks about the same] as an email “retrieved” by TB).

I can only “download” individual ISP emails (their rules, programming) so, hoping to set up a macro to “download” about 100 per day. My ISP inbox is almost full every day with new emails that must be deleted or “moved” due to new emails arriving every day.

Any ideas – or better still step by step suggestions?

Responses in Spanish are fine – French or Portuguese workable.

Dru DruPub@OneImageDru.com
creator: DruPub

title: How to due a "hard string" search in TB?
content:
How to do a "hard string" search in TB? I have asked this question several times over the years and never got a real definitive answer?

I need to find the one email in 1000 that has ONLY these characters in only these spaces ONLY in ONLY this order. Only. I do not need to see any searches that begin with these characters or end with these characters or contain these characters I ONLY want to see ONLY searches with exactly this character in this first space and only this character in the second space, etc ...

The ability to all related to my "string" is fabulous (and much harder) most of the time, but sometimes, I just need to see ONLY that strict "hard string".

It's a basic beginner programmer compare operation. Should be easy, How do I do that (and only that)

Thanks,

Dru DruPub@OneImageDru.com
creator: DruPub
